title: Mumbai Rains Live News: BMC announces holiday for schools, colleges amid Heavy rainfall; streets flooded, local trains hit, amid ‘red’ alert
summary: Mumbai Weather & Rains Today LIVE: For the third consecutive day, Mumbai woke up to very heavy rainfall on Monday. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued ‘red’ alert for the city today and tomorrow, indicating very heavy rainfall throughout the day.
fullContent: Mumbai Weather & Rains Today LIVE: For the third consecutive day, Mumbai woke up to very heavy rainfall on Monday. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued ‘red’ alert for the city today and tomorrow, indicating very heavy rainfall throughout the day. The heavy rainfall also brought the traffic to a halt and created a waterlogging situation in several areas. Traffic was brought to a halt on the Western Express Highway near Vile Parle as heavy rain lashed Mumbai city. Waterlogging was also witnessed in the Gandhi Market Sion area.

summary: Swiggy's shares experienced a surge on Monday following an increase in its platform fee to Rs 14 in high-demand areas, aiming to mitigate widening losses. Despite a doubled net loss of Rs 1,197 crore in Q2, operating revenue rose 54% to Rs 4,961 crore.
fullContent: Swiggy's shares experienced a surge on Monday following an increase in its platform fee to Rs 14 in high-demand areas, aiming to mitigate widening losses. Despite a doubled net loss of Rs 1,197 crore in Q2, operating revenue rose 54% to Rs 4,961 crore. Intensifying competition from new entrants like Rapido's Ownly, offering lower commission rates, adds pressure.

title: Nifty's Critical Support At 24,000, Relative Performance With EMs Crucial, Says CLSA
summary: As long as the Nifty maintains its position above the support, CLSA believes, there's a strong case for upside momentum.
fullContent: As long as the Nifty maintains its position above the support, CLSA believes, there's a strong case for upside momentum.

title: PBOC Signals No Urgency for Rate Cuts Despite Poor Economic News
summary: China’s central bank indicated it’s holding back from aggressively easing monetary policy with moves such as interest-rate cuts, even though the economy just recorded its worst month so far this year.
fullContent: China’s central bank indicated it’s holding back from aggressively easing monetary policy with moves such as interest-rate cuts, even though the economy just recorded its worst month so far this year.

title: India’s E20 fuel push leaves car owners struggling with mileage, repairs
summary: As ethanol-blended petrol rolls out nationwide, car owners face lower fuel efficiency, engine wear, and costly fixes, exposing gaps in awareness and accountability.
fullContent: As ethanol-blended petrol rolls out nationwide, car owners face lower fuel efficiency, engine wear, and costly fixes, exposing gaps in awareness and accountability.

title: Insurance stocks surge up to 5% as Govt to consider GST cut on health and term insurance premiums
summary: Insurance company stocks experienced a surge following the anticipation of a significant GST rate cut on health and term insurance, a long-awaited demand from the industry. The proposed cut is part of the upcoming GST 2.
fullContent: Insurance company stocks experienced a surge following the anticipation of a significant GST rate cut on health and term insurance, a long-awaited demand from the industry. The proposed cut is part of the upcoming GST 2.0 blueprint, which aims to simplify the indirect tax structure and reduce the burden on citizens and businesses.

title: Big tech companies accused of bending H-1B rules with job listings
summary: Amid tech layoffs, major US firms face allegations of bypassing hiring rules by directing job applicants to immigration or “global mobility” teams instead of standard channels, a Newsweek report said.
fullContent: Amid tech layoffs, major US firms face allegations of bypassing hiring rules by directing job applicants to immigration or “global mobility” teams instead of standard channels, a Newsweek report said. Critics argue such practices favour H-1B workers over US graduates, keeping Americans out of jobs. The Trump administration plans reforms to prioritise American workers.

title: GST 2.0 reforms: Centre mulls extra duty on tobacco, states want share
summary: To maintain overall taxation on tobacco products post GST 2.0 reforms, the Centre may impose additional excise or special duty above the proposed 40% GST. Some states are advocating for a significant share in this additional taxation to offset potential revenue losses.
fullContent: To maintain overall taxation on tobacco products post GST 2.0 reforms, the Centre may impose additional excise or special duty above the proposed 40% GST. Some states are advocating for a significant share in this additional taxation to offset potential revenue losses.

title: GST 2.0 reforms: Centre mulls extra duty on tobacco, states want share

title: Glenmark Pharma shares in focus as Q1 profit slumps 86% YoY
summary: Glenmark Pharma reported an 86% YoY drop in Q1FY26 net profit to Rs 46.9 crore, even as revenue stayed flat at Rs 3,264 crore. EBITDA slipped 1.4%, with margins narrowing to 17.7%. India sales rose modestly, while North America saw sequential growth.
fullContent: Glenmark Pharma reported an 86% YoY drop in Q1FY26 net profit to Rs 46.9 crore, even as revenue stayed flat at Rs 3,264 crore. EBITDA slipped 1.4%, with margins narrowing to 17.7%. India sales rose modestly, while North America saw sequential growth. The company highlighted progress in its Ryaltris, QiNHAYO and Winlevi pipelines. Shares closed slightly higher.

summary: It isn’t clear if the four vessels currently heading toward Asia will ultimately find buyers.

title: ED grills Anil Ambani-led Reliance Group executives in Rs 17,000 crore bank fraud case
summary: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is investigating a ₹17,000 crore loan fraud case involving Anil Ambani's Reliance Group. The ED has questioned several senior executives and sought loan details from about 20 banks.
fullContent: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is investigating a ₹17,000 crore loan fraud case involving Anil Ambani's Reliance Group. The ED has questioned several senior executives and sought loan details from about 20 banks. Investigations suggest that Reliance Home Finance and Reliance Commercial Finance allegedly diverted funds to Reliance Infrastructure and Reliance Power.

title: ED grills Anil Ambani-led Reliance Group executives in Rs 17,000 crore bank fraud case
summary: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is investigating a ₹17,000 crore loan fraud case involving Anil Ambani's Reliance Group. The ED has questioned several senior executives and sought loan details from about 20 banks.

title: China hoarding its tech riches fiercely
summary: As Narendra Modi visits China, partnership deals between Indian and Chinese companies face delays. China is carefully vetting technology transfer terms, impacting sectors like appliances and auto components. Haier's stake sale in its Indian unit is held up.
fullContent: As Narendra Modi visits China, partnership deals between Indian and Chinese companies face delays. China is carefully vetting technology transfer terms, impacting sectors like appliances and auto components. Haier's stake sale in its Indian unit is held up. PG Electroplast's compressor project also faces delays. These hurdles affect Indian firms reliant on Chinese technology and components.

title: Alcohol, cigarette, gaming stocks slide up to 4.5% as govt proposes 40% sin tax under GST 2.0 overhaul
summary: The government is planning GST 2.0. It may include a 40% tax on alcohol, cigarettes, and gaming. Consequently, shares of Godfrey Phillips, Nazara Technologies, and Delta Corp declined. Globus Spirits, United Spirits, and ITC also saw drops.
fullContent: The government is planning GST 2.0. It may include a 40% tax on alcohol, cigarettes, and gaming. Consequently, shares of Godfrey Phillips, Nazara Technologies, and Delta Corp declined. Globus Spirits, United Spirits, and ITC also saw drops. The GST revamp aims to streamline rates. Essential items may have 5% tax. Most goods could fall under 18%.

title: Auto sector demand in India weak across segments except tractors: Report
summary: Domestic volumes for auto segment, excluding tractors, decline 6% year-on-year in Q1.
fullContent: Domestic volumes for auto segment, excluding tractors, decline 6% year-on-year in Q1
